data.title: Vitalik Buterin plans Ethereum's quantum-resilience strategy, focusing on 4 key areas for upgrades to handle future challenges.
data.description: A prominent figure in the Ethereum community highlighted the need for improvements in four key areas: validator signatures, data storage, user accounts, and proofs. However, implementing these changes is expected to be a challenging process.

data.title: Tidewater to announce earnings on March 2, 2026 (Three and twelve months ending December 31, 2025). Earnings call on March 3, 2026. CEO Quintin Kneen to discuss results.
data.description: Houston-based Tidewater Inc. (NYSE: TDW) is set to unveil its financial results for the fourth quarter and full year of 2025 on March 2, 2026. Following this release after market close, an earnings conference call will take place on March 3, 2026, at 8:00 a.m. Central Time. President and CEO, Quintin Kneen, will lead the discussion on the company's performance during the mentioned periods. This event will allow investors to gain insights into Tidewater's financial status at the end of the fiscal year.

data.title: Nearly 20,000 wallets hold 100 BTC each in a 'bullish sign', with just 7 wallets needed to reach the milestone amid market uncertainty.
data.description: According to data from Santiment, only seven additional wallets are required to achieve a total of 20,000 holding a minimum of 100 Bitcoin each. This development comes during a period of persistent market instability.

data.description: In Milwaukee on February 26, 2026, Ademi LLP is conducting an investigation into NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) regarding potential breaches of fiduciary duty and legal violations related to its recent deal with Brink's Company. data.title: Leading cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, Dogecoin slipped: BTC at $67,060.77 (-2.13%), ETH $2,007.51 (-2.60%), XRP $1.40 (-2.40%), Dogecoin $0.09678 (-4.29%). Concerns over potential market bottoms with U-turn observed, Bitcoin's market share at 58% and Ethereum's at 10.5%. Over $240 million liquidated in 24 hours, with Bitcoin's open interest down 2.39%. "Extreme Fear" sentiment in market per Crypto Fear & Greed Index.
data.description: Leading cryptocurrencies experienced a decline on Thursday as market uncertainties persisted. Bitcoin dropped by 2.13% to $67,060.77, Ethereum fell by 2.60% to $2,007.51, XRP decreased by 2.40% to $1.40, Solana declined by 3.97% to $85.44, and Dogecoin saw a 4.29% fall to $0.09678 in the 24-hour period. Bitcoin's trading volume decreased by 22%, with its market share at 58% and Ethereum's at 10.5%. Companies like Strategy Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. saw their stock prices drop by 1.66% and 1.57%, respectively. Over $240 million was liquidated from the market in 24 hours, impacting bullish long traders. Bitcoin's open interest and sentiment were down, reflecting a market correction. Retail and whale investors on Binance remained long on Bitcoin positions. "Extreme Fear" sentiment prevailed as per the Crypto Fear & Greed Index.
